title: Picon (footballer)
text:
Fernando Picon da Silva, known as Picon (born 6 February 1976) is a Brazilian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender last playing with <a href="Ituano%20Futebol%20Clube">Ituano Futebol Clube</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Paulo">São Paulo</a>, he begin his career playing with local giants <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Paulo%20FC">São Paulo FC</a>. He was part of São Paulo team that won the 1998 <a href="Campeonato%20Paulista">Campeonato Paulista</a>. He played one season with <a href="Esporte%20Clube%20XV%20de%20Novembro%20%28Piracicaba%29">XV de Piracicaba</a> in 2001 before moving abroad to play with <a href="Super%20League%20Greece">Super League Greece</a> side <a href="Ionikos%20F.C.">Ionikos F.C.</a>
He had a spell in Serbia playing with <a href="OFK%20Beograd">OFK Beograd</a> in the <a href="First%20League%20of%20FR%20Yugoslavia">First League of FR Yugoslavia</a> before returning to Brazil. In 2004, he was playing with <a href="Sociedade%20Imperatriz%20de%20Desportos">Sociedade Imperatriz de Desportos</a> winning with them the state championship in 2005.
After a spell with <a href="Rio%20Preto%20Esporte%20Clube">Rio Preto Esporte Clube</a> in 2006 he will return to <a href="Ionikos%20F.C.">Ionikos F.C.</a> in early 2007, however as the club ended up relegated at the end of the 2006-07 season, Picon was loaned to Chinese side <a href="Shanghai%20Stars">Shanghai Stars</a> until the end of the year.
In 2008, he returned to Brazil joining <a href="Po%C3%A7os%20de%20Caldas%20Futebol%20Clube">Poços de Caldas</a>, a side that had just been formed a year earlier. Between summer 2008 and 2009 he will play with <a href="Esporte%20Clube%20Pelotas">Esporte Clube Pelotas</a>, before finishing the year with <a href="Ituano%20Futebol%20Clube">Ituano Futebol Clube</a>.
